intro: Mikania amara var. guaco, commonly known as guaco, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by tiny, oval-shaped fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Guaco is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
